text: John Macleod (John James Rickard Macleod, 6 September 1876 16 March 1935) was an Scottish physiologist. He won the 1923 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, with Frederick Banting, for the discovery of insulin. ==References== Category:1876 births Category:1935 deaths Category:British Nobel Prize winners Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:British physiologists Category:Scottish scientists
title: John Macleod
